intro: Linderniella brevidens, commonly known as the narrowleaf lindernia, is a small, herbaceous annual plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants known for their square stems and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural areas.
